column4: I'm attempting to create an AMD64 Alternate USB Stick installer (from Windows), but the guide on actualreality.wordpress.com doesn't seem to work, it gives an error when it does 'scan hard drives for an installer ISO image'
The error message it gives is "Error while running 'modprobe -v yenta_socket'
can you show me the exact webpage you are looking at
and what are youd oing when you get that error message?
installer starts, I choose my language, keyboard layout, then it comes up with that error
the dialog behind the error says "Detecting hardware to find hard drives"
what make and model of laptop do you have
what version of ubuntu you trying to install
do you have any pcmcia plugged into it?
Haven't tried Jaunty (I only got the laptop this morning), do you think there would be more chance of it working with Jaunty?
it is the first thing i would try personally.
assuming the problem is really with modprobe yenta_socket
ok, I'll give it a try, thanks
